item.title: Ark Server
item.description: Details> Details # Details> Details # This is a template to add this container to your nas setup full functional with matching permissions and settings that of lochnas repo. Original container turzam/ark

item.title: Collabora
item.description: Details> Details # This is a template to add this container to your nas setup full functional with matching permissions and settings that of lochnas repo. Original container collabora/code How to enable> How to enable # Add the domain ssl replacing domain.

item.title: DDNS setup
item.description: You need your domain name to point to your IP address. This is done by visiting an “Update URL” (sometimes “Dynamic URL”). Go to your domain provider’s website and find the URL for your domain.

item.title: Home Assistant
item.description: Details> Details # This is a template to add this container to your nas setup full functional with matching permissions and settings that of lochnas repo. Original maintainer homeassistant/home-assistant How to enable> How to enable # Add the domain ssl replacing domain.

item.title: Honeygain
item.description: Details> Details # Details> Details # This is a template to add this container to your nas setup full functional with matching permissions and settings that of lochnas repo. Original maintainer itzg/minecraft-server

item.title: LochNAS Folder Structure
item.description: /lochnas/> /lochnas/ # Path to the root of the lochnas folder. This should live in the root folder of the server. We no longer support dynamic paths so that the containers can refference the same root paths internally and reduce user confusion.

item.title: Minecraft
item.description: Details> Details # This is a template to add this container to your nas setup full functional with matching permissions and settings that of lochnas repo. Original maintainer itzg/minecraft-server How to enable> How to enable # Edit your /lochnas/docker-templates/minecraft/.

item.title: Minecraft Bedrock
item.description: Details> Details # This is a template to add this container to your nas setup full functional with matching permissions and settings that of lochnas repo. Original maintainer itzg/minecraft-bedrock-server How to enable> How to enable # Edit your /lochnas/docker-templates/minecraft-bedrock/.

item.title: New name, New website
item.description: We renamed from Docker-NAS to avoid any copyright issues with docker. Thanks to the previous owner of LochNAS we were able to grab lochnas.com to start fresh. We renamed the project repos which requires you to move your install from /docker-nas to /lochnas.

item.title: Nextcloud
item.description: Details> Details # This is a template to add this container to your nas setup full functional with matching permissions and settings that of lochnas repo. Original maintainer Nextcloud, mariadb

item.title: Nginx
item.description: Details> Details # This container allows you to server all your containers trhough port 443 via ssl with only a single port forward set in your router. How to enable> How to enable # Edit your /lochnas/docker-templates/nginx/.

item.title: Prowlarr
item.description: Details> Details # This is a template to add this container to your nas setup full functional with matching permissions and settings that of lochnas repo. This assumes you are using plex and transmission paths.

item.title: RAID setup
item.description: For ldrrp’s setup he followed an online guide by DigitalOcean to setup raid. He has a RAID 5 mounted to /lochnas and another raid 5 mounted to /lochnas/home/plex Maave also set up RAID 5 but had issues with the DigitalOcean guide - he needed to use partitions for RAID to persist.

item.title: LochNAS Setup
item.description: Requirements> Requirements # Ubuntu 20 server or greater is the preffered setup used for this system. root user access Port forwarding 80 + 443 Static IP on Server, alternative is DHCP reservation on router.

item.title: LochNAS Setup OSX
item.description: Requirements> Requirements # OSX is unknown and untested root access Port forwarding 80 + 443 Static IP on Server, alternative is DHCP reservation on router. xcode git Docker Desktop Install> Install # This is untested as of right now, See issue #44 for more information.

item.title: LochNAS Setup Windows
item.description: Requirements> Requirements # Windows is unknown and untested root access Port forwarding 80 + 443 Static IP on Server, alternative is DHCP reservation on router. git Docker Desktop Install> Install # This is untested as of right now, See issue #44 for more information.
